intro: Prunus mutabilis f. odorata, commonly known as the sweet cherry or the white cherry, is a cultivar of the Prunus genus. It is characterized by its white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 8–10 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a serrated margin and turn yellow in autumn. The fruit is a small, sweet cherry that ripens in late summer.
